comments.body: Th red dragon part of this post is cool.
it would be cool if we could tame the red dragon with raw mutton and ride it.
No way! Thats in the mob vote this saturday
I swear to god that if they dont emit light I will quit and protest for it to be added.
This would make the mob particularly useful when found in dark caves. It would be the first mob to emit light.

Seeing as they didn't add this functionality, I personally think this would be an amazing idea.

However, the light should probably be 6 or 7.

That would be cool.

If so, there should also be an NBT tag to describe what the light level should be, minimum being 0, maximum being 15.

it would go like:
/summon glowsquid ~ ~ ~ {LightLevel:15}
They need to add dynamic lighting in general.

I love the idea of a flying mount. Maybe if not a Pegasus, be able to enchant horse armor or attach the glider, elitra? I don't know the spelling. My idea tho is ENCHANT A SADDLE TO MAKE PIGS FLY! Also, what if you could catch a phantom with a fishing pole and then tame it for flying. And one more thing, make tames more loyal such as saddled horses, donkey, mules.... So that they don't wonder off when you dismount.

Flying pigs sounds cool and everything. A Pegasus also sounds cool, but what if we add more things like the shards you get from the Eldar guardian you can tame a merhorse that can swim in water and can go very fast but on land they go slower than in water. We could
also have a dragon that comes in different colors base off of what it breaths like a red one can have fire breath and purple can have lightning and blue can breath water and green can spray acid, and maybe you can bread to different one together and possibly get one that has both breathing. And one other thing we need more biomes and cooler textures and way more bosses because minecraft just becomes boring.

Came here to post this same idea! I agree, the spawn should be rare or hard to find. Breeding should be either low chance or hard to gather/create item. Also they could require fuel while flying, where they go to ground when meter is low to graze.
sería genial si hubieran unicornios UwU

translated from Spanish: "It would be great if there were  unicorns"

sería genial si hubieran unicornios UwU
Add a unicorn boss or a new dimension
Idk bro, the nether is suposed to be a dangerous place
Also it shares another viewpoint to the nether, and provides more opportunities to get off onto nether masses that are just above the lava.

At first, I was a little disappointed to not see tall and lanky, alien mobs waddling through the magma lakes. That being said, I really like the fact that the way they "stride" through the lakes is due to what I can only assume to be bits of netherite glued to their stumps. 

But also, I think a brood mother-esque, mega tall style strider or just another mob with big long legs would be really neat and I want to see it now.

This could be also implemented like this:
Putting a saddle 2< stacked striders and using fungus-stick would move the lowest one making striders more fun.
They could either be really tall walking on the lava or have really tall legs underneath the lava
Removed "new mob" as it will definitely help improve search results.
Make this much more aggressive and maybe make them swarm and you have me on board.
This is great, although I think the spiders should have the dull purple and bright teal color scheme of the warped trees.
What why don’t you call it a warped crawler that makes it sound like it hasn’t been copy pasted.

that is a great idea but the warped forest was intended to be the most peaceful biome in the nether. so I think maybe the hostility of the spider can be removed or it spawns in a different biome...

this is only my suggestion, but I think this is a great idea and Mojang should add it into Minecraft!

I really like this idea. It wouldn’t make bats useless anymore. Also just think about changing the title to something like, “A new purpose for bats” or something because I thought it was a bat which was Half dolphin or something. Anyways good idea
Maybe some buff if it flies in a similar pattern to your movement. Similar buff to if you are swimming with dolphins?
Woah cool! You have my vote
Really awesome. I can't find your Restless one though.
Interesting. I like it!
These should perch on the roof of the biome.
Do they have long necks and legs with sharp talons? Also, can they walk, are they immune fire, and are they undead?
I think they should be called Scorn Swoopers, instead of Soul Swoopers.
Bro how ever said they stood perch throw the roof that make no sense plase that makes no sense
Love this idea. They should make them big and afraid of players.

That's a good idea.
The elk is probably neutral and okay if nothing is done, but when attacked it should be hostile.
The attack power is also high and it is quick.
THe elk should eat wheat and some other fruits of the forest, like oaks, nuts, high grass.
They should turn logs into their stripped variants and only spawn in Taiga biomes
I had this idea for plains biomes only.  I think it would be a good addition to just specific areas that don't currently have a lot going on.  I think they should attack if you attack them also.

I love this idea.I have had many cases where I want to take off the chest of an animal, but the game wont let me.If we can take of saddles, horse armor and carpets why cant we take off chests!The space on mules, donkeys, and llamas where horse armor would usually be could be the chest space.
Maybe left click with a axe

Yes! Please! I find the absence of this option SO annoying. 

p.s. I found a command on the Minecraft forum that will delete the chest off the animal (I tested it on Java). It's a bit cumbersome to type and took a couple times for me (as I am new to using commands) to get right but it did the thing. You just have to stand right next to the llama or whatever you want the chest off of so it effects the right one. I still think there should be a simpler option.

/data modify entity @e[type=llama,limit=1,sort=nearest] ChestedHorse set value 0b
"Utility? Being cute." Sorry, no vote.
It needs more utilities, but I like the idea.

I love chinchillas and adding them to Minecraft would be awesome. I just don't think "cute" is going to get Mojang's approval. In my opinion, I think they should be able to lead you to treasure or jungle temples when you feed them like cocoa beans or apples or something, like a dolphin when you feed it fish with the particles behind it. Taming it would be cool, but I do not think that there would be another tamable pet anytime soon (although I would love to see it!) and it would be more like a fox how it runs away from you but can be lured in by their breeding food. Anyways I think it is a great idea, let's get more votes so Mojang can see it!
this should be the case for bats. They won't be useless anymore and that the bats should have a craft-able pack that has 4 slots.
They could also carry 1-2 Items per flight making trading more effective between players.
Great idea

I wholeheartedly agree - even if it's just the ability to tame them and have them follow you. Perhaps have an option like ocelots that bring out different skin options at random for the trained ones too!
This would be fun, but here's another thing you can do: /tell (Insert Player Name Here) (Insert Message Here)
HONEY BADGERS!!!!!!!! :D
This sounds amazing, we need this.
Cool I think badger s will be great for Minecraft feedback
Profanity is not allowed on this website.
That post is 3620 characters. Normally you can only have a post with a maximum of 1500 characters.
Make a mod on this.  It would be a pretty good mod.  However, I don’t think they should add this straight into Minecraft.
Your "Vapor" should be considered a mini-boss!
I think the item should be called “Gas” and the block should be called “Concentrated Gas”
Mob has been modified and is now called an Ooze :D
i just battled the ender dragon and something hit three times in a row months work of items have now been lost and i wanna destory  minecraft now.

Ever heard of feather falling bro? It stops fall damage making it super good. Or you could just MLG water. And yes I am a bedrock player saying this. Also bosses I think are meant to be challenging and shouldn't be a cakewalk, because then what's the point of a boss?
I have killed the ender dragon without breaking all the crystals, with full protection IV armor and sharpness V sword and a strength potion. No need to nerf at all!
Or drop bears
We have pandas so please add cute animals with Kolas and ucliptis trees.

Koalas would be tempted and bred with a new plant, eucalyptus. They would be fed with grass, since the breeding item and feeding item shouldn't be the same. The koala would be found sleeping or (rarely) climbing/eating in the savannah biome on an acacia tree. Koalas are very cute, so please add them to Minecraft.
Instead of the savannah biome, you could have a new biome, the outback.
I love the idea of more animals in Minecraft, b koalas seem like they would exist for just ambience. Because of this, I disagree with other comments suggesting taking them.
Also it could spawn at the bottom of deep ocean biome.

This is a brilliant idea. I really hope this gets added. 

by the way will you be able to pick them up in a bucket?
It should only spawn close to the surface though, to be realistic.
Amazing Idea! This will really fit into Minecraft 1.17

There actually is a blindness potion. I'd suggest looking up the recipe. Another thing, when the glow squid was announced, they said it would NOT harm players. The squid is pretty, and that's about it. I really like the idea of glowing ink sacks.
To go off that idea, I think the glowing ink sacks should be able to make glowing blocks, and glowing water. That way you'd have a few new light sources.

Great Ideas, I agree! Especially because the tinies kept saying they were distracted by it. This has been suggested before by being accomplished through ink sacks. https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360021300792-Blindness-potions

I think there should be a potion of glowing from the glowing ink sack and a potion of blindness from the regular ink sack. which already utilizes mechanics in the game.

I like your ideas as well but I think it should be a little more simplistic so here are my ideas

1. They SHOULD drop glow in the dark dye. This would give the bedrock platform a way to see in the dark without holding torches. (Java players can hold torches in their off hand to travel caves without placing the torch itself)

2. The glow squids should glow more brighter when it’s night time. This would give the deep oceans more life and live up to the name GLOW squid. (Light level should be equivalent to sea pickles in my opinion)

I want a potion of glowing that can be use and emits light around the player, the trade off is mob aggro range is further. This way the light can be used underwater while swimming in the under water caves, or under the ocean. Additionally potions of splashing glow will affect mobs, and make them glow Axolotls when use on will further help emit light underwater make them aggro guardians more, and be really cool looking under water. For people not wanting to hurt the mob, if you use a potion of glowing you can go up to the squid with a bucket and milk them for the glow ink, other wise they will stun you for maybe 3 seconds and swim away. So after you kill a few you can glow craft ink sacks into a gue that can be used to make a potion. Then if you want to get more in the future with less hassle, you use potion of glowing milk squid with bucket, bring it back to cauldron, use glass bottle to bottle it for brewing. 1 cauldron makes like 6 glass bottles or something. Adding different dye in the brewer makes light effect different colors. Red light cave flare style.
@ChillValor, Java players can't hold torches in their offhand for it to give off light unless they have mods or Optifine
When Glow Squids shoot out ink it could either stun mobs and/or give them night vision

I think it should apply an effect called something like ”Focus”, that would forcibly move your gaze towards the [effect strength]th (Maybe? Just an idea.) nearest mob away from you when you’re close (5 blocks at most) to it for a few seconds, making it so your movement would be impaired in an interesting manner, while not completely stunning you, staying true to the description the Tinies gave about it being ”distracting”.

This could even be used by the player, for example to hunt Rabbits or defend themselves from Baby Zombies.
It would also allow for map makers to steer the player’s gaze smoothly instead of using /teleport.
Sounds good to me I like the idea of the ocean getting harder the lower you go

I think the mob should be larger since small hitboxes brought a lot of complaints. I see them as basically silverfish (should be more dangerous though, since low attacks and health but having to deal with a bunch of them is just annoying and they're in deep underground or oceans where unprepared players don't go to), jump like slimes when they're on land and like fishes in the water.

Seeing how they're lapis-colored, they could drop some lapis in addition to glowstone dusts. They're neutral, but like the Warden, they attack sound sources as potential food, similar to piranhas but with sound instead of scent. They'd be at a deeper/different area of underground caves than the warden (they have eyes, but realistically, fishes in the deep parts of the ocean sense vibrations rather than have actual eyes). Because they spawn in the water, players don't have to fight them too often.

They have a follow range of 16. In deep oceans, they are neutral and are distracted by nearby fishes. In caves where there are less food sources, they feed on nearby mobs and players. The neutral part is that the whole swarm attacks players who attacked (without killing) one of them while vibrations make only one hostile.
Where did you make your texture for this mob?
I used Blockbench to create the model and textures.

Unique idea, and I believe the ocean could benefit from more "fantasy" type mobs, since the only such mobs are now are the two guardians and the drowned. Though I think this mob could benefit from a slight buff (maybe deal a bit more damage).

 

Also, instead of only being in the ravines, there could a be a separate biome(s) for the deep sea, which could have it's own structures and other types of mobs to go along with the deep sea spyfish.
Cool creature concept. Should also be a predator of glow squids, which could be another source of their bioluminescence.
More aquatic life is definitely what Minecraft needs.
It wouldn't really make them a challenge, just an inconvenience.
Clarified topic to ensure better search results.
This is a lot like my soul Swooper idea. Check it out. Very cool idea.

It would be a bit odd to tame and breed something that is half human.

Aside from that, I'm generally cool with any mythological creatures (especially minotaurs)

I agree with TriassicScone: Although I'm down for mythological creatures (especially this -- it reminds me of the Chronicles of Narnia), I think breeding and taming an animal with near or greater than human intelligence in almost all of its interpretations is not a good idea.
I also had this idea and I think someone beat me to it!

NERF THE SKELETONS THERE OP.
maybe have it  as a difficulty thing, like harder difficulties have faster skeleton shooters
The skeleton deal is bs, because they are ether way to strong at the start with to much damage, range, and fire rate. But the rest of the game they aren't strong because of the shield.
The skeleton deal is bs, because they are ether way to strong at the start with to much damage, range, and fire rate. But the rest of the game they aren't strong because of the shield.

I think that the skeletons in Minecraft Bedrock shoot very quickly when you are close to them and that makes no sense since in the Minecraft Java version they take more time to shoot and move from left to right, but in Minecraft Bedrock It remains in a fixed position to shoot very quickly. Please, you should reprogram the skeleton for the sake of minecraft bedrock players, it is very frustrating and makes you want to stop playing the game anymore.
they shoot a lot faster and they have almost perfect accuracy in bedrock
The Bedrock Skeletons are beyond BS. Please Mojang, why, oh why, after all these years of yammering about Java parity, you've not prioritized one of the worst cases of non-parity in this game?

Here is an idea that I think would make them better . 1 there should also be a type of mermaid that sits on rocks they will trade with you, and the trades should be good. (So that the player would get close enough to hear the siren) 2 the should not follow you Youl just lose control of your character, heart particles will show up around you and your screen will turn pink, this should also be an effect called love. 3 But once your on the island the beautiful mermaid will become its true form! It is a scaly monster with big flipper like wings on its back and a flipper like the mermaid it's eyes will turn red and it's head will be the shape of a dolphins they are green and scaly, and make a sound like this "hehehehehehehehermmmm if killed it will and drop the flute of the siren which will let you enslave any illager or make villager give you free stuff ,only one has per flute effect on illagers is permanent take not of this comment please!

maybe not singing to lure, maybe an amazing drop, they may have the item on their chest, and drop it. They will also hit hard.Causing reckless players deaths.

MOJANG LISTEN TO THIS AMAZING POST! WE NEED NOT DROWNDS, BUT SIRENS! (Also thank you @brooklycannon06, this is amazing that I am not the only person who loves mythology!) I feel like there should be the three types of sirens that mythology mentions: the celestial, the generative, and the purificatory / cathartic. The first would have blonde hair, the second brown, and the third, black for they’re respecting rulers. (The first under Zeus, the second under Poseidon, and the third Hades.) The sirens should also be added to the Greek Mythology Mash-up world pack that is in the Marketplace. If you have stuck around long enough to read this through, I will be very happy!

Thx!
i like the idea! i would want there to be a rare chance of a siren being nice or something and it could lead you to treasure or something- idk just a thought
The sirens should drop the Nautilus shell instead of the drowns so that there's a pretty good reason for them to be in minecraft
